iati-activity.description: IMPROVE ACCESS TO SAFE DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES, SANITATION SERVICES AND INCREASE AVAILABILITY OF IRRIGATION SERVICES.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: EDUCATION FOR ALL PROGRAMME
iati-activity.description: ENSURE ACCESS TO EDUCATION FOR ALL BY ELIMINATING GAPS IN ENROLLMENT BETWEEN VARIOUS POPULATION GROUPS, ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF EDUCATION AND AND INCREASE THE EFFICIENCY OF THE EDUCATIONAL SYSTEM

iati-activity.title: CHILDREN SCHOOL RIGHTS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION
iati-activity.description: DEVELOPING LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION THROUGH GIVING CHILDREN ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION.

iati-activity.title: RURAL WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION PROJECT IN WESTERN NEPAL
iati-activity.description: RWSSP-WN REPLICATES THE FINISHED RWSSSP IN THE ADJACENT ZONES TO LUMBINI ZONE IN ORDER TO TRANSFER THE EXPERIENCE TO THE NEW DISTRICTS. IN ADDITION THE PROJECT CONTINUES THE WORK ON THE ARSENIC MIGITATION AND SANITATION THAT HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED BY THE RW
iati-activity.sector: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Promoting Quality Education
iati-activity.description: Although the education system is developed all the time in Nepal, still many of the students in the project area in Kathmandu Valley leave school before finishing their basic education studies. This dropout rate has been recognized to be the developmental problem within this project frame. There are plenty reasons for this reality. The activities of this project try to tackle some of them. During the project the awareness and community of the community towards the education of their children will be strengthened by mobilizing them and giving the parents literacy classes. The management of school funds will be turned more transparent by strengthening parents teacher associations. Teachers will be trained to improve the quality of education and to make school environment more school friendly. Children will be given opportunities to express themselves through child clubs.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Manari Arsenic Mitigation and Sanitation Project
iati-activity.description: Aims: improve health status and living conditions of the local population in Manari, with an emphasis on the deprived sections of the villages
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Nepal tourism, outdoor and environment development project
iati-activity.description: Aims: sustainable development (including social, economic and environmental sustainability) of trekking related tourism in selected areas of Katmandu Valley (Dhulikhel); increase of environmental awareness among local inhabitants, private sector and visiting tourists. Activities: construct trekking-related facilities (toilets, information boards, signpost tracks, resting places); organise waste management; environmental awareness raising; organise campaigns for better environment; children's environmental education

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Empowering Partners for Social Responsibility. The project aims to increase the capacity of a local partner to do holistic development work in local communities. Nepal is one of the poorest countries in the world_ where majority of the people live in rural areas. Fidaâs partner in Nepal is the Assemblies of God church (AOG). The project provides training and awareness-raising for the partner on a great variety of issues related to development work. Fida and AOG work together in the local communities and through this hands-on development work the partner acquires practical skills. The project focuses on three major components: Literacy_ Community Health Education (CHE) and HIV/AIDS. As AOGâs skills and knowledge grow_ the partner will become increasingly capable of doing effective community development work of its own. This will contribute to the increasing impact of the partnerâs work at community level.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Maithili Empowerment Programme. The programme seeks to increase a local partnerâs capacity to respond to the needs of the Maithili minority in Southern Nepal. The 2.5 million Maithili of Southern Nepal make up the countryâs largest ethnic minority. Formerly known for their rich culture and traditions_ the Maithili now live in poverty and have almost lost their unique identity. To address the needs of the Maithili_ Fida partners with a local NGO called Relative Nepal_ which belongs to the Assemblies of God Nepal (AGN) church. The programme offers the partner hands-on training in community development work. The main approach used is that of Community Health Education. The work carried out among the Maithili communities includes e.g. literacy training_ basic education and cultural revitalization activities. Through the trainings and practical development work conducted during the programme_ the partnerâs capacities build up and_ at the same time_ the needs of the Maithili communities are addressed. Already one school has been established and childrenâs literacy classes started. These together will contribute towards the improvement of the quality of life in the Maithili communities.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Youth Centre in Kathmandu. The project seeks to empower a local partner for youth work of its own. Now_ after the civil war_ the capital of Kathmandu is facing a huge wave of immigration from the rural areas to the city. The young generation in particular is moving into the city in search for work_ but lacks sufficient skills and training. Fida partners with the Assemblies of God church (AOG) to address the needs of the youth. Fida and its partner will establish a youth centre in the capital that provides vocational training and counselling to the youth_ and facilities for leisure time activities. The AOG church youth will act as volunteers at the centre. Through the youth centre the partner will learn to work with the youth in practice. The youth_ in turn_ will have their educational and other needs addressed. All in all_ the project will improve the life skills of the youth.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: NEST Rural Development Center. Supporting the agricultural education courses to the people from rural villages

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: HDCS Ngo and Rural Community Development Support. Supporting the local Ngo in its organisational skills. Supporting discriminated people through different social programs.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: AHTCS Animal Health Program. Supporting the local NGO in its efforts concerning animal health education.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: CCD-N Rural Community Development Project. Supporting the socio-economic status of landless communities.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: UMN Health Care Programme. Preventive health care work and district doctor training program.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: UMN Education Project. Imrpove the school administration and the cooperation between teachers and parents. Supporting literature classes in communities.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Shanti Basic Health Care Development Programme. Supporting Shanti NepalÂ´s Chapagaun Health Centre

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: CMC-N School Mental Health Program. Developing the mental health care in local schools.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: TEACH Social Work among Children. Supporting teacher training and vocational education.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Enpowering governmental and civil society/child labour
iati-activity.description: There aremore than 1.8 million children involved in labour sector in Nepal. Ending the child labour exploitation needs necessary policy and program interventions by government both at local and national level. Local governments lack the ability to respond to the child labour problem at their area. Partner organization CWISH has been working for a decade to eliminate child labour with different strategies, also with some local government institutions. These previous interventions have been mainly implemented at capital area focusing only on municipalities due to strong conditioning of previous donor. According to the experience of partner of high need to continue the started work that has been left in half way, this project instead will include all the relevant stakeholders from National to local level, in selected 14 municipalities where the most cild labour abuse in Nepal is located.

iati-activity.title: Project preparation in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Project preparation, monitoring and evaluation in Nepal.

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Katmandu
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Katmandu

iati-activity.title: Strengthtening of Environmental Administration in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The project aims to strengthen environmental administration and management at the local level in order to protect, enhance, sustain and monitor the environment, and also provide healthier and ecologically more diverse living environments for the population in the area, as well as enhance occupational health concerns and build the capacity at the local level. The goal is to build and integrate a local level environmental administration and management model to monitor the environment in Nepal.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / School Disaster Risk Reduction Programme in Nepal
iati-activity.description: To reduce the risk of disasters by strengthening coping capacities of most vulnerable communities by training students and teachers by using local resources

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Equal Education for All Fond
iati-activity.description: Sponsoring a child by financing the education of children from underprivileged families

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Reducing poverty in Nepal_ through innovative and equitable carbon fin
iati-activity.description: Aim: To establish functional and equitable carbon financing programme in place based on avoided deforestation and forest degradation; engance knowlwdge and scientific basis on forest carbon; strengthen the capacity of the government and local communities on REDD mechanisms. Activities: Research_ forest and carbon inventories; establish database on carbon stock; awareness raising and training.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Participatory development of livelihoods_ natural resource mangement a
iati-activity.description: Aims: To prevent forest fragmentation and degradation in Terai area in Nepal; to enhance forest rehabilitation and increase wildlife in forest corridors; to enhance local livelihood and reduce vulnerability of marginalized communities; to empower local community forest user groups_ buffer zone forest user groups and community-based anti-poaching groups; to increase knowledge and awareness of the effects of climate change. Activities: Studies_ inventories and monitoring of forest resources and socio-economic changes; training and awareness raising of local community-based organizations about the sustainable use of forest resources_ income generating activities_ micro-credits etc; training of community-based anti-poaching groups; capacity building of CBOs; preparation of forest and grassland management plans for CBOs.

location.name: Nepal; districts of Kanchanpur_ Kailai Bardia_ Banke_ Dang_ Chitwan_ Parsa and Bara

iati-activity.title: Technical Assistance for Leasehold Forest and Livestock Development
iati-activity.description: Technical Assistance programme to be implemented through a partnership between IFAD and FAO_ is proposed. The main objective is to improve the effectiveness of LFLP and support the implementation_ institutionalization and scaling up of the poverty reducing leasehold forestry programme in the country. The key activities include: integration of leasehold forestry and livestock development for poverty alleviation; consolidation and improvement of the extension strategies; follow-up the findings of the studies carried out by the ongoing IFAD supported LFLP and FAO supported TCP Project: institutional framework for a greater contribution of forests and trees to poverty reduction; institutionalization of the and livestock development for poverty alleviation and environmental conservation; establishment and promotion of a goat breeding centre.

iati-activity.title: Forest Resource Assessment in Nepal
iati-activity.description: There is a need for strengthening of the forestry sector information systems_ to enable the realistic preparation of new Master plan and to monitor effectively the impact of recent forest activities after conflict period. The use of TA aim to strengthen the procedures needed for the capture and processing of the National level statistics and support district level forest decision making as well dissemination of information. The overall objective is to strengthen national forest policy level decisions.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The project's objective is to reduce the use of child labour by providing education for children, and to support trade union activities in the brick kilns in order to improve wages and working conditions. In order to achieve these objectives, the project includes various activities: children's education, campaigning, member recruitment, literacy circles for adults, and sessions on gender issues.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Rewrite the Future. Purpose of the programme is to ensure that the education system provide basic quality education to all children by increasing access_ retention_ improving teaching and learning environment and ensuring safe and protective environment in schools and communites in 20 VDCs of Sindhupalchowk district to around 35 000 children by 2010.

location.name: Sindhupalchowk area in Bagmatti Zone_ Nepal

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)
iati-activity.description: Providing basic and vocational education and healthcare for children and youth with special needs in Kathmandu
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Disaster Preparedness. Reduced impact of disasters on vulnerable population and increased capacity of the population to respond and recover.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Nepal Development Programme . To organize and empower focus groups to enjoy their rights to land, food, water and other resources including services from the state.
iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Capacity Building. To contribute LWF Nepalâs staff individual capacity development to widen their skills, understanding and confidence that facilitates organizational development
iati-activity.sector: Support to local and regional NGOs

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Landless people in Nepal . To empower and capacitate freed Haliya and Kamaya to claim and enjoy their rights and develop their livelihood

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Capacity Building for Advocacy Work in Nepal . Provision of support for developing and reinforcing local capacity building in advocacy activities as a follow up activity of âthe Invisiblesâ thematic campaign (ending 2009)
iati-activity.sector: Support to local and regional NGOs

iati-activity.title: Support to Nepal's School Sector Reform Programme
iati-activity.description: The GoN has requested the Development Partners to support the education sector through the School Sector Reform (SSR) Program. The overall objective of the SSR is to contribute towards poverty reduction through inclusive, responsive and accountable local governance and participatory community-led development. The Program Development objective is to increase access to and quality of school education especially for children from marginalized groups.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening the Capacity of National Human Rights Commission of Nepa
iati-activity.description: This project will support the NHRC in implementing its Strategic Plan 2008-10. The project will support to improve the capacity of NHRC in the areas of i) auditing human rights compliance issues in legislation, policies, plans, practices and procedures which will ensure respect for human rights by state actors, ii) ensuring the effective implementation of the international human rights instruments to fulfill state obligations, iii) ensuring human rights in the forthcoming constitution and iv) protecting and promoting the civil, political and socio-economic rights. This project will support the NHRC to build both its capacity to work with stakeholders and to meet its accountability and obligations through public opinions, inclusive work processes and reporting.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Promoting Child Rights Through Educational Settings
iati-activity.description: The school enrolment ratio of children in Nepal is almost 87 percent, but still the drop out rate is also very high, almost 100 children enrolled in grade one only 22 percent appear the school leaving examination. Children experienced discrimination, have suffered violence on the name of discipline, are victims of political conflict and have suffered sexual abuse. The school curriculum is not childrenÂ´s right responsive and friendly. The project aims to promote and protect child rights in and through educational settings and policies with the active involvement of parents, community and children themselves. The project promotes significantly schools and other educational sectors role on promoting childrenÂ´s rights at local and national level and to ensure child rights in schools benefits children directly.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Improvin sexual and reproductive health
iati-activity.description: The project builds on the previous efforts of improving sexual and reproductive health of young people.

location.name: Nepal, Kathmandu Valley; Lalitpur, Bhaktapur, Kavre, Sindhupalchowk

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Integrated river basin management at Koshi River
iati-activity.description: The trans-boundary Koshi basin provides freshwater for livelihoods and ecosystem services for millions of poor people in Nepal and India. Due to the pressure from anthropogenic sources and climate change the stability of the system is under threat. The project purpose is to ensure pro-poor sustainable socio-economic and environmental development in Koshi basin based on the principles of Intergrated River Basin Management. The objective is to reduce vulnerability of people, biodiversity, and economic investments in the Koshi River basin caused by climate change and human activities.

location.name: Nepal, Koshi River Basin (eastern Nepal), Indrawati sub-basin

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Livelyhood and Environmental Awareness Project
iati-activity.description: The project aims to strengthen women's position in decision-making and will improve sanitation and health by building the eco toilets and giving the health guidance. Project includes the education of the local people of constructing the eco toilets and in service training for the local health advisors. Income generating activities are included to enhance the willingness to participate.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Strengthening the capacity of Nepal Scouts
iati-activity.description: Strengthening the capacity of Nepal Scouts.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / GPHRC hospital development project
iati-activity.description: To keep and provide quality of services to larger number of disabled people needing rehabilitation and medical services in western part of Nepal.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Supporting Democracy through Investigative Journalism
iati-activity.description: The development problem the project seeks to address is the need for well-researched, in-depth reports for increasing the quality of the depate for supporting democratisation, peace building and governance in Nepal. Nepal began it's peace process in November 2006 and it is believed that the media can play a major role in moderating expectations through fact-based research and therefore contribute positively in the transformation processes.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Bilingual Literacy Project in Lhomi and Nepali
iati-activity.description: The objective of this project is to increase the number of functional literate children and adults in both Lhomi and Nepali and create enough credibility from the local community to develop projects in the area of health, education, IGAs and advocacy.This will be done through organizing literacy classes in close cooperation with local village committees.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Regional Solid Waste Management Project in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the project is to establish a sustainable, regional solid waste management system in the area of Sunsari and Morang districts in Nepal. This is achieved through an institutionalised cooperation between the municipalities of the two districts providing services also to the surrounding VDCs.

iati-activity.title: Increased Capacity of Hydrometeorological Services ICI-project
iati-activity.description: Finnish Meteorological Institute and the Department of Hydrlogy and Meteorology under the Ministry of Environment have together proposed a ICI-project for Increased Capacity of Hydrometeorological Services in Nepal. The project aims to improve the capacity of DHM in hydrometeorological observations, services and international data sharing and thus improve the capability of the Government of Nepal to respond to the increased risks of natural disasters related to weather and climate.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Strategic Framework and Operational Plan 2009-2013, AfP. The Embassy of Finland has signed a Memorandum of Understanding among Alliance for Peace and its Strategic Partners (Danida Hugou and MS Nepal)to enter into a Strategic Parnership for next three years. The total cost of the five year programme is approximately NPR 89 million or about 890 000 Euros.The overall objective of the Strategic Partnership mechanism is to forge stronger donor alignment with civil society goals and objectives, and enhanced harmonization of support to CSO partners in Nepal with a view to improving aid effectiveness and reduce transaction costs.Alliance for Peace five year strategic framework and operational plan has been divided into five thematical areas:1. Internal democratization of political students and youth wings 2. Human rights and transitional justice 3. Peace building and conflict transformation 4. Youth engagement and outreach in constitution building 5. Strengthening AfP Nepal, partner organizations and youth peace dialogue centres.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Acute Watery Diarrhoea Response. Project period: 14.8.2009 - 15.2.2010, extension until May 2010. Project goal is to contribute to the prevention and control of the spread of epidemic and deaths through strengthening and coordinated humanitarian response in the areas of water, sanitation and hygiene promotion in the 17 districts of Far and Mid-Western Development Regions. Awareness raising and media campaign on hygiene, sanitation and water purification reaches 793 314 beneficiaries in all 17 affected districts. Finland has bilateral water, sanitation and health projects in 6 affected districts. Finland's projects can utilize Nepal Red Cross awareness rising and IEC materials and Nepal Red Cross can utilize Finnish water testing know-how and tools for cholera testing. Area is among the Nepal poorest and worst affected are women and children. Project areas: Kanchanpur, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Doti, Bajhang, Bajura, Achham, Kalikot, Dailekh, Surkhet, Jajarkot, Salyan, Dolpa, Rolpa, Pyuthan, Dang, Kailali.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Road to Copenhagen: Youth action for Climate Change. Project period: 14.10.2009-30.4.2010 Project goal is to increase regional, national and local level awareness and build capacity of youth in order to produce well apt versatile youth group that can play a vital role to foster dialogues and campaigns to actively participate and advocate for favourable policy changes nationally and internationally in relation to climate change. Project areas: Biratnagar, Bharatpur, Pokhara, Birendranagar, Dipayal and Kathmandu.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Nepal Security Sector Network. Project period: 14.10.2009-13.10.2010. The NSSN will support the Nepali Government and national security institutions by systematically analyzing, producing, debating, and advocating policy recommendations on the issues of security sector governance on a national and regional level. The Network coordinates the intellectual leadership of Nepalâs civil society, academia, researchers, and practitioners in order to create a sociopolitical consensus on policy issues and their solutions. The NSSN engages in the process that develops collaboration and even partnerships with concerned institutions and individuals responsible for decision and implementation of security issues. In this process NSSN works with the Nepali Government, Nepali civil society organizations and other international organizations. Project area: Kathmandu.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The Sari Soldier Outreach. Project period: 1.11.2009-31.1.2010. The outreach of the Sari Soldiers will be carried out in six districts in east and west of Nepal. Each screening will be follow by discussions, moderated by an experienced moderator, around areas of gender, impunity, disappearance, reconciliation and justice.The idea of the outreach is to take the film to rural audiences so that by watching and subsequent interaction, they can better understand the situation they faced, still face and what they could to do resolve or come to term with the trauma they might have experienced. The film will be taken also to the District Administrators who were in the past directly or partially responsible for the suffering of the people and who are in a unique position today to redress and provide justice for past crimes. The primary target area for the outreach are regions that have less access or no access at all to means of communication. Project areas: Dailekh, Doti, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Udayapur, Pancht.

iati-activity.title: Our school is a good school primary education development project
iati-activity.description: Nepalâs education system canât offer child friendly school environment to all. Projectâs development problem is that public schools and teachers lack adequate teaching learning methods and infrastructure resulting children dropping out of schools. This project aims to strengthen teacherâs role in their community and inside the education system, form learning network among teachers, promote childâs rights and participation in schools and sensitize stakeholders to take responsible role for implementation. Through these activities the objective of this project: Child Friendly School concept is widely accepted and practiced in public schools in the project area. Motivated and skilful teachers and inspiring and safe school environment are available to all the children at the 14 schools in 5 VDCs will be reached.

iati-activity.title: Integrating Sexual and Reproductive Health and Biodiversity
iati-activity.description: The project implements an integrated population, health and environment (PHE) approach. The objective is improved sustainable management of natural resources and increased access to sexual and reproductive health (SRH) services contributing to improved livelihood in environmentally critical areas of Terai Arc Landscape. Income generating activities, biodiversity conservation and SRH rights and services are promoted. Food security and climate change adaptation with some mitigation activities, as well as capacities of community-based organisations are developed.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon SÃ¤Ã¤tiÃ¶, WWF Suomen Raha

location.name: Districts of Dang, Chitwan, Banke, Bardiya and Kailali, Terai, Nepal

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian aidto Nepal through UNHCR
iati-activity.description: Humanitarian assistance through UNHCR to Nepal
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of the program is to improve the socio-economic conditions of rural poor households of Kanchanpur district of Far Western Nepal through diversified sustainable production , processing, enterprise development and marketing of organically produced MAPs.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of the project is to increase biodiesel feedstock and promote clean energy and rural income generation through management and cultivation of Jatropha curcas. Specific objectives are: to analyze the land use patterns and suitability for Jatropha curcas cultivation; to increase awareness on collection, management and cultivation of Jatropha curcas; to produce Jatropha seedlings for commercial plantation; to improve local economy through Jatropha seed production; to establish marketing linkage between Jatropha producers and biodiesel company; to conduct trial experiment for optimization of Jatropha genotype and place; to conduct a pilot scale biodiesel testing program.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Overall objective: To contribute to achieve the millennium development goal (MDG) through providing educational, economical opportunities and empowering to the Musahar children and adult who have the lowest socioeconomic status in Siraha and Saptari districts of Nepal by the end of February 2011.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Overall objective: To raise the voice of Dalit from local level by improving the quality and quantity of media coverage on issues of Dalit, its rights, diversity and social inclusion. Increase Dalit journalists within and outside the Dalit organizations; Sensitize the non-dalit journalists and media houses on dalit issues to develop and mainstream dalit issues into their regular programme; Institutionalization of Radio Jagaran through internal system development and connecting with people and institutions under cooperative mode.

iati-activity.title: FNBEs Support Services for Education Sector Cooperation in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The main purpose is to provide support in planning, follow-up and analysis to the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in relation to the development of education sector (especially TEVT) in Nepal. Part of the assignment is to assist in planning and follow-up of the implementation of the SSRP and to participate in the joint meetings and reviews.

iati-activity.title: Sanitation and Water for all in the context of Climate Change in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The UNICEF WASH-programme supports the Government of Nepal in its efforts to formulate and implement one national WASH program to achieve the national target of universal water supply and sanitation coverage by 2017. The programme is implemented throug five components: 1)Support for capacity-building and formulation of a national WASH programme, 2) District level coordination and harmonisation and support for WASH programme interventions, 3) improved interagency coordination on WASH emergency preparedness and response, 4)Rollout of a comprehensive hygiene promotion initiative in selected diarrhoea-prone districts, 5): Scale-up of school WASH, hygiene promotion (including hand washing with soap) and community approaches to total sanitation (CATS), using children as agents of change.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Rural Village Water Resources Management Project, Second Phase
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of RVWRMP is institutionalised capacity at local and regional levels to sustain and continuously improve enhanced quality of life, better environmental conditions and increased opportunities in rural livelihoods in the project area. The purpose of the phase II is to achieve improved well-being and reduced poverty in project VDCs. The new phase emphasises the impacts of the project instead of means.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of the program is to improve the socio-economic conditions of rural poor households of Kanchanpur district of Far Western Nepal through diversified sustainable production , processing, enterprise development and marketing of organically produced MAPs. Specific objectives; Identify the sources of MAPs and traditional knowledge and practicesImprove the MAPs management practices of CFUGs, Develop community based MAPs enterprises, establish local level processing centre as common facility centre , identify and analyse potential national and international markets, identify and develop technology and an extension package at local, national and international levels.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The overall objective of the project is to increase biodiesel feedstock and promote clean energy and rural income generation through management and cultivation of Jatropha curcas. Specific objectives are 1)to analyze the land use patterns and suitability for Jatropha curcas cultivation, 2)to increase awareness on collection, management and cultivation of Jatropha curcas, 3)to produce Jatropha seedlings for commercial plantation, 4)to improve local economy through Jatropha seed production, 5)to establish marketing linkage between Jatropha producers and biodiesel company, 6)to conduct trial experiment for optimization of Jatropha genotype and place, 7)to conduct a pilot scale biodiesel testing program.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Overall objective: To contribute to achieve the millennium development goal (MDG) through providing educational, economical opportunities and empowering to the Musahar children and adult who have the lowest socioeconomic status in Siraha and Saptari districts of Nepal by the end of February 2011. Specific objectives: 1.To increase access of Musahar children to educational opportunity through educational campaign, tuition and extra supports. 2.To form and strengthen saving and credits groups in Musahar community through reflect literacy classes to raise the literacy rate of adult Musahars (both women and men) 3.To enhance the institutional capacity of the Rastriya Musahar Uthan Samaj (RMUS) for monitoring, advocacy and networking with local level networks for Musahar rights.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Overall objective: To raise the voice of Dalit from local level by improving the quality and quantity of media coverage on issues of Dalit, its rights, diversity and social inclusion. Increase Dalit journalists within and outside the Dalit organizations, Sensitize the non-dalit journalists and media houses on dalit issues to develop and mainstream dalit issues into their regular programme, Institutionalization of Radio Jagaran through internal system development and connecting with people and institutions under cooperative model.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Nepal
iati-activity.description: Increase income generation opportunities and maintain social peace and harmony among marginalized women/youth of Mahottari district through cooperative development

iati-activity.title: Support to Constitution building in Nepal
iati-activity.description: The project is to be implemented within the International IDEA ongoing project Supporting Constitution Building in Nepal by including additional outcomes and activities. The objectives are to 1) build capacity of key political actors involved in Nepal's constitution making process, and 2) initiate and deepen dialogue among key political actors towards building consensus on these constitutional issues.
iati-activity.participating-org: International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (IDEA)

iati-activity.title: Support to National Human Rights Commission of Nepal
iati-activity.description: National Human Rights Commission, NHRC, is a central constitutional human rights body in Nepal. Commissionâs work focuses on monitoring transitional justice and human rights promotion. Finland with other donors has been supporting a UNDPâs capacity building project. This project will further enhance the Commissionâs capacity especially in the fields that intertwine with other Finnish involvement, such as, investigation of human rights violations and human rights work in education sector. The project duration is 18 months during 2010-2012. The total budget is 185 000 euros.
iati-activity.participating-org: Recipient Government, National Human Rights Commission (NHRC)

iati-activity.title: Nepal Peace Trust Fund
iati-activity.description: The Government of Nepal has established a Nepal Peace Trust Fund in order to establish sustainable peace in the country. The overall objective of the Fund is to support successful implementation of the Comprehensive Peace Agreement signed between the Government of Nepal and the Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist). The Peace Fund provides a mechanism to channel and coordinate resources in four key areas.

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Long term partnership with a local company / organisation (e.g. joint venture; subcontractor, import or other contract agreement )

iati-activity.title: Enhancing Child Protection System in Nepal
iati-activity.description: In spite of commitment, government of Nepal has been inefficient to meet the requirements for protecting children from different forms of abuse, violence and exploitation. NGOs have become crucial actors, though the actions of NGOs are also questioned and sometimes their capacities and skills are also questioned. The government child protection policies are still waiting for formal adaptation. The project aims at establishing child protection system and mechanism at local level with appropriate policy guidance. Specific objectives are: promotion of national child protection network, application of child protection policies, and strengthening of local child protection committees. The project has component of advocacy, network building, capacity building, and production and sharing of resource materials.
